articles.title: Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN
articles.description:
You'll find it on Martha's Vineyard.

The post Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: CNN ranks Martha's Vineyard as one of the best nude beaches in the U.S.
The beach offers a unique experience for locals and tourists seeking clothing-optional options.
Boston residents can access this popular destination for summer relaxation and recreation.

articles.title: Return-to-office has settled. Is this as good as it gets for downtown?
articles.description:
Commuter rail growth has flattened, and no major new work shifts have been announced for September.

The post Return-to-office has settled. Is this as good as it gets for downtown? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Commuter rail usage in Boston has plateaued, indicating a shift in work patterns.
No significant changes in office work schedules are expected for September 2023.
Downtown Boston's economic recovery may stall without new job growth initiatives.

articles.title: ‘It’s not weird’: The people who love to stare at airplane flight maps
articles.description:
According to FlightPath3D, an in-flight map provider for more than 90 airlines, about 68 percent of passengers open the map on seat-back screens and 20 percent view only the map.

The post ‘It’s not weird’: The people who love to stare at airplane flight maps appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FlightPath3D reports 68% of passengers use in-flight maps on seat-back screens.
20% of passengers exclusively view the flight map during their journey.
Increased interest in flight maps may enhance travel experience for Boston residents.

articles.title: Driving school manager gets prison time for passing unqualified drivers in State Police license fraud scheme
articles.description:
Scott Camara, 44, pleaded guilty in April to charges of perjury and conspiracy to falsify records.

The post Driving school manager gets prison time for passing unqualified drivers in State Police license fraud scheme appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Scott Camara, 44, sentenced for passing unqualified drivers in a fraud scheme.
Camara pleaded guilty to perjury and conspiracy charges in April 2025.
The scheme jeopardized public safety by allowing unqualified drivers on Boston roads.

articles.title: Red Sox reportedly calling up pitching prospect for MLB debut, sending Dustin May to IL
articles.description:
Connelly Early is set to make his first career start.

The post Red Sox reportedly calling up pitching prospect for MLB debut, sending Dustin May to IL appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Red Sox call up pitching prospect Connelly Early for MLB debut.
Dustin May placed on the injured list, impacting team rotation.
Local fans anticipate Early's performance in upcoming games.
